dialog: Greetings! It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance, Diane.
Greetings, Jack. It's lovely to meet you as well.
I presume you've had a change of heart regarding our proposal, Diane.
Indeed. After much consideration, I must admit the quality of your air conditioners is most impressive. The only issue at hand is the cost.
It doesn't surprise me, many customers share your sentiment. Might you have any suggestions? Our sales associate informed your secretary that the price may be negotiable.

That's why I made the journey to your office today. Our suggestion is for the model WE-506 to be priced at $590, as similar air conditioners from other companies are typically priced between $579 and $649.
That is true, but if you understand that quality is the most important aspect of a product, you'll agree that $679 is not excessive, especially with a 10% discount we're offering.
I can see your point. So that would be $611 per set. However, that is still higher than the market price. Is there any way to lower the cost, Jack?
Well, given the quantity of your order, we could reduce the price further to $600. That's the lowest we can go. What do you think of that?
Agreed. $600 per set it is then.
Very good. Many thanks.
Have we met before?
I'm not certain. You look familiar, though.
Are you Mr. Stevenson, by any chance?
Yes, that's correct. And you are Mr. Jones, if I'm not mistaken.
And with that, we've covered all the basic information about our company. I trust you have a good understanding of who we are.
Indeed, I have a general knowledge of your company.
Once we have the final results, we shall send word to you.
And when can I expect a response at the latest?
Should you pass the interview, the personnel department will inform you within two fortnights.
